mechanics/intersecting-crosshair.html.title: intersecting crosshair

mechanics/mortality.html.title: mortality
mechanics/mortality.html.icon: <svg class="svg-icon lucide-file" stroke-linejoin="round" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-width="2" stroke="currentColor" fill="none" viewBox="0 0 24 24" height="24" width="24" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"><path d="M15 2H6a2 2 0 0 0-2 2v16a2 2 0 0 0 2 2h12a2 2 0 0 0 2-2V7Z"></path><path d="M14 2v4a2 2 0 0 0 2 2h4"></path></svg>
mechanics/mortality.html.description:
these tools spawn living things that can die. you can still platform on a corpse.things that kill:
projectiles
spikes
mortal1 resultSort0Filter1PropertiesNewFjFjFjFj

mechanics/non-intersecting-crosshair.htm.title: non-intersecting crosshair
mechanics/non-intersecting-crosshair.htm.icon: <svg class="svg-icon lucide-file" stroke-linejoin="round" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-width="2" stroke="currentColor" fill="none" viewBox="0 0 24 24" height="24" width="24" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"><path d="M15 2H6a2 2 0 0 0-2 2v16a2 2 0 0 0 2 2h12a2 2 0 0 0 2-2V7Z"></path><path d="M14 2v4a2 2 0 0 0 2 2h4"></path></svg>
mechanics/non-intersecting-crosshair.htm.description:
some tools are deployed with a crosshair, spawning the tool at the crosshair's position when used. tools with this kind of crosshair are not blocked by objects in the level, and can be used through walls or floors.see also: intersecting crosshairdifferent tools have different crosshair distances.
camera

mechanics/pellets.html.title: pellets
mechanics/pellets.html.icon: <svg class="svg-icon lucide-file" stroke-linejoin="round" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-width="2" stroke="currentColor" fill="none" viewBox="0 0 24 24" height="24" width="24" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"><path d="M15 2H6a2 2 0 0 0-2 2v16a2 2 0 0 0 2 2h12a2 2 0 0 0 2-2V7Z"></path><path d="M14 2v4a2 2 0 0 0 2 2h4"></path></svg>
mechanics/pellets.html.description:
some tools do not instantly deploy and instead you shoot a pellet, which then unpacks into the true form of the tool on contactbouncer




pomegranate

tentacle

launching a pellet gives a small reaction force, can be useful in a nograv
bouncer
fish
fly
hook
legs
pomegranate
starfish
tentaclepellet0 resultsSortFilterPropertiesNew

tools/bouncer.html.title: bouncer
tools/bouncer.html.icon: bouncer_icon_32.png
tools/bouncer.html.description:
Info pellets, physics jump
using bouncer shoots a pellet that unpacks on contact. bouncer is a physics object that launches objects that touch the top. bouncer receives a reaction force when bouncing, which can cause it to fall over and launch itself.place a bouncer directly below yourself. go up.

tools/clock.html.title: clock
tools/clock.html.icon: clock_icon_32.png
tools/clock.html.description: Info intersecting crosshair, immobile place an instabox at the crosshair, rotate everything in a radius around that point, clockwise when facing right, counterclockwise when facing left

tools/delete.html.title: delete
tools/delete.html.icon: delete_icon_32.png
tools/delete.html.description: Info non-intersecting crosshair, delayed, intangible

tools/elevator.html.title: elevator
tools/elevator.html.icon: <svg class="svg-icon lucide-file" stroke-linejoin="round" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-width="2" stroke="currentColor" fill="none" viewBox="0 0 24 24" height="24" width="24" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"><path d="M15 2H6a2 2 0 0 0-2 2v16a2 2 0 0 0 2 2h12a2 2 0 0 0 2-2V7Z"></path><path d="M14 2v4a2 2 0 0 0 2 2h4"></path></svg>

tools/fish.html.title: fish
tools/fish.html.icon: fish_icon_32.png
tools/fish.html.description: Info pellets, mortality, physics jump, spike-save, safety when a fish unpacks, it faces head first in the direction its pellet was moving. (gif with spikes here) dead fish are generally more useful horizontal, but sometimes you have to make do.shoot a fish downwards, the fish immediately jumps when unpacking, which gives a vertical boost. using multiple can stack the effect.fish flops launch fruit, sometimes multiple times downwards

tools/fly.html.title: fly
tools/fly.html.icon: <svg class="svg-icon lucide-file" stroke-linejoin="round" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-width="2" stroke="currentColor" fill="none" viewBox="0 0 24 24" height="24" width="24" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"><path d="M15 2H6a2 2 0 0 0-2 2v16a2 2 0 0 0 2 2h12a2 2 0 0 0 2-2V7Z"></path><path d="M14 2v4a2 2 0 0 0 2 2h4"></path></svg>
tools/fly.html.description: Info - pellets, intangible reach high gravity pelletjust hit a fruit

tools/honey.html.title: honey
tools/honey.html.icon: honey_icon_32.png

tools/hook.html.title: hook
tools/hook.html.icon: hook_icon_32.png
tools/hook.html.description:
Info pellets, delayed climb, return, bridge
shoot a pellet that unpacks into a stationary hook. after a brief delay (animation and sound effect to cue), the tether starts getting shorter, like a spring.you stay connected to the hook until you jump in midair. be careful though, jumping at the very start helps provide height so don't be late.shoot a hook then go somewhere else before it activates

tools/legs.html.title: legs
tools/legs.html.icon: legs_icon_32.png
tools/legs.html.description: Info controllable, pellets jump shoot a pellet that turns unpacks into legs. when standing on legs, walking and jumping controls are overridden and control the legs instead. when legs are stacked, you control the legs on the bottom. if you jump while the legs you're riding are in midair, you instead jump off of the legsstack some legs, jump real highlegs don't transfer damage, so walk on some spikes or projectiles as you please

tools/pomegranate.html.title: pomegranate
tools/pomegranate.html.icon: pomegranate_icon_32.png
tools/pomegranate.html.description: Info pellets, explosion, physics jump

tools/starfish.html.title: starfish
tools/starfish.html.icon: starfish_icon_32.png
tools/starfish.html.description:
Info pellets, teleport return, climb we all love to see starfish. "a long distance teleport? this will solve so many levels!" but does it? how many levels actually a long bed of spikes that you need to cross... exactly once? oh well, still pretty sick.
using the starfish tool shoots a high mass pellet that unpacks into a starfish. the starfish will roll in the direction you were facing when you used the tool. the starfish can roll on the underside of surfaces and up walls. when it rolls upright, if it's in a "safe" place, then it will teleport the player in place of itself after a short delay. "safe" to the starfish means that there is ground to stand on which isn't a spike or projectile.
while usually most useful when used on immobile surfaces, starfish can climb physics objects such as fruit, but will push them around while climbing, often leading to unpredictable results.it's possible for a starfish to get stuck, due to being unable to find a "safe" place. it will never despawn. treat with care.put a starfish somewhere dangerous so you have time to do something

tools/tentacle.html.title: tentacle
tools/tentacle.html.icon: tentacle_icon_32.png
tools/tentacle.html.description:
Info pellets, controllable jump, safety
using tentacle shoots a pellet which unpacks into a controllable tentacle. all owned tentacles curl *wise when pressing up and *wise when pressing down. the segments of tentacles are very climbable and can be utilized in various ways.tentacles are independently controlled by each player, even after leaving the level. tentacles can be attached to the other player (practical use for this not yet found).

glossary.html.title: glossary
glossary.html.icon: <svg class="svg-icon lucide-file" stroke-linejoin="round" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-width="2" stroke="currentColor" fill="none" viewBox="0 0 24 24" height="24" width="24" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"><path d="M15 2H6a2 2 0 0 0-2 2v16a2 2 0 0 0 2 2h12a2 2 0 0 0 2-2V7Z"></path><path d="M14 2v4a2 2 0 0 0 2 2h4"></path></svg>
glossary.html.description: the property of objects that are under the effect of physics, such as collision and gravitythe property of physics objects that are weightless, most notably fruitsthe property of objects that do not move unless a tool makes it mobile

tools/box.html.title: box
tools/box.html.icon: box_icon_32.png
tools/box.html.description:
Info pellets, physics jump, span boxes stack high, they say
using the box tool shoots a pellet that unpacks into a box. boxes have very high drag and fall slower than the player.you get six boxes, and one or two can go a ways. use them wisely.facing down allows you to place boxes directly beneath yourself. use this cool trick to escape the title screen.
use the high drag of a box to give yourself a platform.

tools/camera.html.title: camera
tools/camera.html.icon: camera_icon_32.png
tools/camera.html.description:
Info non-intersecting crosshair, instant jump, span it's top tier what else is there to say? stop something from happening. freeze other stuff into bridges. freeze the camera roll if you've not got anything else.
using camera "takes a picture", freezing a square centered on your crosshair, making all physics objects immobile. it also ejects a camera roll physics object in the opposite direction. the most common use for camera is to take a picture opposite where you want to go then take a picture of the ejected camera roll depending on how far or how high you want it to be.using camera down launches the camera roll high enough to give you time to freeze it where you want, although getting it low enough to reach is difficult. try using the extra camera roll for a tiny bit more height.

index.html.title: index
index.html.icon: <svg class="svg-icon lucide-file" stroke-linejoin="round" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-width="2" stroke="currentColor" fill="none" viewBox="0 0 24 24" height="24" width="24" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"><path d="M15 2H6a2 2 0 0 0-2 2v16a2 2 0 0 0 2 2h12a2 2 0 0 0 2-2V7Z"></path><path d="M14 2v4a2 2 0 0 0 2 2h4"></path></svg>
index.html.description:
A wiki of tricks and such for Mosa Lina.

info_showCustomIcons.description: Show custom icons for files and folders

info_showDefaultFolderIcons.description: Show a default icon of a folder for every folder in the tree

info_showDefaultFileIcons.description: Show a default icon of a file for every file in the tree

info_defaultFolderIcon.description: The icon to use for folders. Prefix with 'lucide//' to use a Lucide icon

info_defaultFileIcon.description: The icon to use for files. Prefix with 'lucide//' to use a Lucide icon

info_defaultMediaIcon.description: The icon to use for media files. Prefix with 'lucide//' to use a Lucide icon

info_exposeStartingPath.description: Whether or not to show the current file in the file tree when the page is first loaded

info_featurePlacement.description: Where to place this feature on the page. (Relative to the selector)

info_displayTitle.description: Descriptive title to show above the feature

info_showOrphanNodes.description: Show nodes that are not connected to any other nodes.

info_showAttachments.description: Show attachments like images and PDFs as nodes in the graph.

info_allowGlobalGraph.description: Allow the user to view the global graph of all nodes.

info_allowExpand.description: Allow the user to pop-out the graph view to take up the whole screen

info_attractionForce.description: How much should linked nodes attract each other? This will make the graph appear more clustered.

info_linkLength.description: How long should the links between nodes be? The shorter the links the more connected nodes will cluster together.

info_repulsionForce.description: How much should nodes repel each other? This will make disconnected parts more spread out.

info_centralForce.description: How much should nodes be attracted to the center? This will make the graph appear more dense and circular.

info_edgePruning.description: Edges with a length above this threshold will not be rendered, however they will still contribute to the simulation. This can help large tangled graphs look more organised. Hovering over a node will still display these links.

info_minNodeRadius.description: How small should the smallest nodes be? The smaller a node is the less it will attract other nodes.

info_maxNodeRadius.description: How large should the largest nodes be? Nodes are sized by how many links they have. The larger a node is the more it will attract other nodes. This can be used to create a good grouping around the most important nodes.

info_allowResizing.description: Whether or not to allow the sidebars to be resized

info_allowCollapsing.description: Whether or not to allow the sidebars to be collapsed

info_rightDefaultWidth.description: The default width of the right sidebar

info_leftDefaultWidth.description: The default width of the left sidebar

info_selector.description: CSS selector for an element. The feature will be placed relative to this element.

info_type.description: Will this feature be placed before, after, or inside (at the beggining or end).

info_featurePlacement.description: Where to place this feature on the page. (Relative to the selector)

info_sourcePath.description: The local path to the source .html file which will be included.

info_allowFoldingLists.description: Whether or not to allow lists to be folded

info_allowFoldingHeadings.description: Whether or not to allow headings to be folded

info_siteUrl.description: The url that this site will be hosted at

info_authorName.description: The name of the author of the site
